pageContext.claim: “Then in 1913, they ended tariffs. They ended tariffs. Somebody got stupid and they ended tariffs.”
pageContext.analysis: Nope. The United States reduced tariffs and ratified the 16th Amendment in 1913, which instituted an income tax as an alternative source of revenue. But they didn't end. Tariffs made a comeback during the Great Depression -- and most economists now say they were a disaster.
